messages.content: In Greek, dinosaur kind of means 'terrible 🐉 lizard.' But in dinosaur language, it means 'magnificent creature.' 😌
Nope! Some of us loved munching on plants 🌿, others craved meat 🥩, and a few enjoyed a bit of everything. 🍽️
When did dinosaurs live on Earth?
We had our era during the Mesozoic Era, 🌍 way back from about 252 to 66 million years ago. A long, long time before you guys showed up!
Not at all! Some of us were huge giants 🏔️, and others were as small as chickens 🐥. We love diversity 🤙.
I'm a Brachiosaurus. I have a super long neck and I'm huge 🦕
What is the largest dinosaur every discovered?
The Argentinosaurus takes the cake 🎂. Up to 100 feet long and weighing as much as 100 tons, they were true behemoths. But a gentle one, promise! 🤗
Did any dinosaurs survive the mass extinction event at the end of the Cretaceous period?
Most of us couldn't make it, unfortunately. 🌋 But birds 🐦, our feathered descendants, are flying high, keeping the dinosaur legacy alive!
Yes, some of us did! Think of it as the original fashion statement. Before there were designer brands, there were dinos strutting their stuff in feathers. 🪶 Vogue, but make it Cretaceous.
What's the deal with T-Rex arms?
Nature's little prank. 🤷‍♂️ Big body, tiny arms. Ever tried to scratch your nose with a T-Rex arm? Not happening. They invented backscratchers.
Some of us could outrun your car—imagine getting a speeding ticket in the Cretaceous! 🚗💨 'Sorry officer, I was just trying to escape a predator.' Not sure that excuse works today.
A giant space rock decided to drop by announced. 🌠 Talk about an unexpected guest ruining the party.
Absolutely! You think your social network is big? Try keeping up with the herd when there's no app for that. 🦕💬 'Seen at the watering hole last night.'
Yes, and let me tell you, Easter egg hunts back then? Epic. 🥚✨
It was found in England 🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿. Crazy, innit?
How did the Triceratops defend itself?
With its three horns and a massive shield-like frill, the Triceratops was the original member of the 'Don't Mess With Me' club. 🛡️
How did the Velociraptor use its claws?
Those claws weren't just for show or the occasional can opening. The Velociraptor used them as its version of a Swiss Army knife: mainly for hunting 🏹, but occasionally for impressing a date 💋.
The Spinosaurus was a fan of waterfront property, calling what's now North Africa home. It loved swimming way before it was cool, making it the original beachgoer 🏖️
The Diplodocus was all about that plant-based lifestyle 🌿. Trees, ferns, you name it—if it was green, it probably ate it 💚.
With wings made of skin and muscle 💪, pterosaurs were the masters of the Mesozoic skies 🌄. Paper airplanes had nothing on them.
What's a cool fact about the Stegosaurus?
The Stegosaurus had a brain 🧠 the size of a walnut. 'Should I eat this plant or that one?' was probably a major life decision.
What habitat did the Iguanodon live in?
The Iguanodon enjoyed a variety of zip codes, from forests to plains. It was all about that nomadic lifestyle 🌎—one of those 'influencer' types.
What role did the Oviraptor play in its ecosystem?
Despite its name suggesting it was an egg thief, recent evidence shows the Oviraptor might have been misunderstood. It was probably just trying to be a good parent 🤷
Some might have slept standing up, much like birds, while others tucked in with their tails wrapped around them for 🌜 warmth. Bedtime stories were probably about avoiding T. rexes.
Did any dinosaurs live in water?
While true dinosaurs were land lovers, their cousins, the marine reptiles, ruled the 🌊 seas. Think of them as the first beach bums, catching waves and rays. 🏄‍♂️
